questions.question_text: Has there been any technological impact on equipment components or systems over the past 10 years?
Since WA Mining is a new site, should we expect its equipment to show different patterns compared to other sites?
WGP and Kwinana have shown a decrease in the number of records over time. What does this indicate?
In 2023, there is about 50% increase of records, why?
Does this sample data accurately reflect the real data distribution across all sites, or was it randomly selected?
Are records completed all at once, or does their completion depend on different stages of the operational workflow?
What is the exact order of stage field values and the overall workflow progression?
Why doesn't the stage field change even when there are multiple records for the same action request number?
Are some fields only completed because they aren't required until later stages of the workflow?
Which fields are optional and which ones are mandatory to fill in?
Why do some action requests have multiple records while others have single records?
What are the different patterns between single-record and multiple-record action requests?
What are the documented definitions for each category value in the 'categories' field?
How do we define and identify recurring problems? With over 30% occurrence rate, are these incidents truly repeating?
What is the relationship between the completion field and stage field? How do they interact in the workflow?
Why does the action types field show only unique values? Is this a limitation of the sample data?
Why are WA Mining's initiating and receiving departments concentrated in one area compared to other facilities?
